thread.title: Report: Brewers get new pitching coach from Cubs
thread.title_full: Report: Brewers get new pitching coach from Cubs - UPI.com

author: upi.com
title: Report: Brewers get new pitching coach from Cubs
text:
| License Photo The Milwaukee Brewers hired Chicago Cubs minor-league pitching coordinator Derek Johnson as their pitching coach, MLB.com reported Thursday.
Johnson is making the move with the National League Central to replace Rick Kranitz, who was fired three weeks ago.
Johnson has worked as a minor-league pitching coordinator for the Cubs since 2013. He previously was the pitching coach at Vanderbilt for 11 years.
The Brewers have made numerous staff changes after a disappointing 2015 season, but Craig Counsell will return as manager in 2016.
Johnson inherits a pitching staff that ranked 10th in the National League this season and 11th in 2014.
  Sveum accepts Cubs manager job Cubs pitching coach resigns Cubs pitching coach resigns Cubs announce coaching staff
